intro: Beaumaria, commonly known as the white sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a rough texture. Beaumaria is an herbaceous perennial that blooms from spring to early summer.
